text: Welcome to This is My Architecture.
My name is Sangpill Kim from AWS Korea.

And today, we invite Mr. Kyotack Kim
from Samsung Electronics.
Thank you for coming here, Kyotack.
Thank you for having me, Sangpill.

I'm tech charge
in Samsung Developers Portal.
Yeah.

Then, what is the Samsung
Developer Portal is for?
My project is for supporting
Samsung Developer's ecosystem.

- And my project has developer signup.
- Yeah.

And developer community, news,
blog, and one-on-one support.
Yeah.

And my system is consists
to either GIT and ECR.
Yes.

And this is the content
management layer.
Okay.

And also, we have a Route 53
and front-end.

And also, front-end,
back-end to create ELB.

- Yeah.
- Yes.

Then, why did you start
with using AWS project
and Amazon ECS at first?
As you know in these days,

Kubernetes is very famous
infrastructure orchestration tool.

But my team wanted
to have a more easier one.
So we have tested a lot

and the VP does
some kinds of pilot system.
Yeah.

But I think AWS Fargate
is the most easiest
to container management tool so far.
I see that.

Then, were there
any challenges or difficulties
in managing the AWS Fargate?

As you know
when we're using the AWS Fargate,

in this case,
we can't see our EC2 servers at all.
Right.

Even if when I access
to our web consoles
and they are no information.

And so it is a little bit strange
for me.
Yeah.

But in these days,
me and my colleagues

is familiar
with serverless architecture
in AWS Fargate.
Yeah.

How did you build
the microservices architecture
on your services?

Samsung Developer Portal
has overdone 15 microservices.
And when we're using the ECS,

there is a constable with task services
and the cluster.
Yeah.
And every single microservice
is mapped to read the ECS tasks.
I see that.

Then, what are the benefits
of using the AWS Fargate
for your service?
When you're using the AWS Fargate,

in this case,
we do not need to manage
and mount EC2 instance clusters.

And when we maintaining
the EC2 clusters,

we have to managing
the auto scaling group
and monitoring and health checking.

And in terms of cost saving,
how do you save your cost?

There are multiples to savings
compared with ECS and EC2,
which was about 44.5% cost savings.

It was not much different
with what was told by AWS.
I see that.

Thank you
for sharing details, Kyotack.

And what is the next steps
for Samsung Developer Portal?
Samsung Developers Portal

is being planning
on new site opening next year.
And my team member is spending time

to build
the Site Reliability Engineering.

And we are focused
on delivering the meshing

that is provided
by application-level networking.
Yeah.

Thank you for sharing details,
Kyotack.

- Thank you.
- Thank you.

Thank you for watching
This is My Architecture.
